question: What is MediShield Life?
text:
MediShield Life is a basic health insurance plan designed to protect all Singapore Citizens and Permanent Residents against substantial medical bills <cite> <doc>5f47555dMinistry2024 pages 1-5 quote1</doc> <doc>5f47555dMinistry2025 pages 1-3 quote1</doc></cite>.  It covers hospitalizations and selected outpatient treatments <cite> <doc>5f47555dMinistry2024 pages 1-5 quote3</doc> <doc>5f47555dMinistry2025 pages 1-3 quote1</doc></cite>, including subsidized and non-subsidized treatments, although the latter will have less coverage <cite> <doc>5f47555dMinistry2024 pages 1-5 quote4</doc><doc>5f47555dMinistry2024 pages 1-5 quote5</doc></cite>.  Coverage applies regardless of age or pre-existing conditions <cite> <doc>5f47555dMinistry2024 pages 1-5 quote1</doc> <doc>5f47555dMinistry2025 pages 1-3 quote2</doc></cite>, although those with serious pre-existing conditions may pay additional premiums for the first ten years <cite> <doc>5f47555dMinistry2025 pages 1-3 quote3</doc> <doc>5f47555dMinistry2024 pages 8-13 quote2</doc></cite>.

Premiums are payable annually and can be paid using MediSave <cite> <doc>5f47555dMinistry2024 pages 5-8 quote8</doc> <doc>5f47555dMinistry2025 pages 1-3 quote4</doc></cite>.  The government provides subsidies to keep premiums affordable <cite> <doc>5f47555dMinistry2024 pages 1-5 quote2</doc> <doc>5f47555dMinistry2024 pages 8-13 quote5</doc></cite>, and no one loses coverage due to inability to pay <cite> <doc>5f47555dMinistry2024 pages 1-5 quote10</doc> <doc>5f47555dMinistry2024 pages 13-17 quote4</doc></cite>.  Claims involve deductibles and co-insurance <cite> <doc>5f47555dMinistry2024 pages 1-5 quote7</doc><doc>5f47555dMinistry2024 pages 1-5 quote8</doc> <doc>5f47555dMinistry2024 pages 17-22 quote1</doc><doc>5f47555dMinistry2024 pages 17-22 quote3</doc></cite>, and Integrated Shield Plans (IPs) can supplement MediShield Life coverage for broader protection <cite> <doc>5f47555dMinistry2024 pages 1-5 quote9</doc> <doc>5f47555dMinistry2025 pages 1-5 quote1</doc></cite>.

references.filepath: MOH/MediShield Life/Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured (Nov 2024).pdf
references.citation: Ministry of Health, "Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured." (2024): 1-27.
references.quote: MediShield Life is an individual basic medical insurance scheme that protects all Singapore Citizens and Permanent Residents against large medical bills for life, regardless of age or health condition.

references.filepath: MOH/MediShield Life/FAQs on cancer treatment financing (Jan 2025).pdf
references.citation: Ministry of Health, "FAQs on cancer treatment financing." (2025): 1-7.
references.quote: The changes to cancer treatment financing allow us to negotiate lower prices for cancer drugs, and ensure that cancer treatment costs and insurance premiums remain affordable for Singaporeans in the long term.

references.filepath: MOH/MediShield Life/Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured (Nov 2024).pdf
references.citation: Ministry of Health, "Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured." (2024): 1-27.
references.quote: MediShield Life covers expenses incurred for hospitalisations and selected approved outpatient treatments, such as kidney dialysis, cancer drug treatment and radiotherapy for cancer.

references.filepath: MOH/MediShield Life/FAQs on cancer treatment financing (Jan 2025).pdf
references.citation: Ministry of Health, "FAQs on cancer treatment financing." (2025): 1-7.
references.quote: The changes to cancer treatment financing allow us to negotiate lower prices for cancer drugs, and ensure that cancer treatment costs and insurance premiums remain affordable for Singaporeans in the long term.

references.filepath: MOH/MediShield Life/Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured (Nov 2024).pdf
references.citation: Ministry of Health, "Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured." (2024): 1-27.
references.quote: Patients who seek non -subsidised treatments in Class A/B1/B2+ wards in public hospitals or private hospitals will also be able to benefit from MediShield Life.

references.filepath: MOH/MediShield Life/Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured (Nov 2024).pdf
references.citation: Ministry of Health, "Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured." (2024): 1-27.
references.quote: However, as such non -subsidised bills are much higher, MediShield Life will cover a smaller portion of the bill.

references.filepath: MOH/MediShield Life/Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured (Nov 2024).pdf
references.citation: Ministry of Health, "Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured." (2024): 1-27.
references.quote: MediShield Life is an individual basic medical insurance scheme that protects all Singapore Citizens and Permanent Residents against large medical bills for life, regardless of age or health condition.

references.filepath: MOH/MediShield Life/FAQs on cancer treatment financing (Jan 2025).pdf
references.citation: Ministry of Health, "FAQs on cancer treatment financing." (2025): 1-7.
references.quote: MediShield Life and MediSave will only cover treatments on the Cancer Drug List CDL from 1 September 2022.

references.filepath: MOH/MediShield Life/FAQs on cancer treatment financing (Jan 2025).pdf
references.citation: Ministry of Health, "FAQs on cancer treatment financing." (2025): 1-7.
references.quote: The CDL will only come into effect for Integrated Shield Plans (IPs) on 1 Apr 2023, upon renewal or application.

references.filepath: MOH/MediShield Life/Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured (Nov 2024).pdf
references.citation: Ministry of Health, "Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured." (2024): 1-27.
references.quote: Only those with serious pre-existing medical conditions need to pay a nominal Additional Premium of 30% for 10 years, in addition to the standard Med iShield Life premiums.

references.filepath: MOH/MediShield Life/Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured (Nov 2024).pdf
references.citation: Ministry of Health, "Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured." (2024): 1-27.
references.quote: The annual premiums can be fully paid using MediSave.

references.filepath: MOH/MediShield Life/FAQs on cancer treatment financing (Jan 2025).pdf
references.citation: Ministry of Health, "FAQs on cancer treatment financing." (2025): 1-7.
references.quote: We encourage you to discuss with your doctor if there are suitable alternatives on the Cancer Drug List CDL that are subsidised and covered by insurance.

references.filepath: MOH/MediShield Life/Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured (Nov 2024).pdf
references.citation: Ministry of Health, "Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured." (2024): 1-27.
references.quote: The Government provides various premium subsidies and support measures to ensure that MediShield Life premiums remain affordable.

references.filepath: MOH/MediShield Life/Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured (Nov 2024).pdf
references.citation: Ministry of Health, "Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured." (2024): 1-27.
references.quote: Premium Subsidies are provided to low - to middle-income Singapore Citizens and Permanent Residents with a household monthly income per person of $3,600 and below and living in residences with an Annual Value of $2 5,000 and below.

references.filepath: MOH/MediShield Life/Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured (Nov 2024).pdf
references.citation: Ministry of Health, "Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured." (2024): 1-27.
references.quote: No one will lose MediShield Life coverage because he cannot afford to pay his insurance premiums.

references.filepath: MOH/MediShield Life/Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured (Nov 2024).pdf
references.citation: Ministry of Health, "Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured." (2024): 1-27.
references.quote: No one will lose MediShield Life coverage due to financial difficulties.

references.filepath: MOH/MediShield Life/Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured (Nov 2024).pdf
references.citation: Ministry of Health, "Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured." (2024): 1-27.
references.quote: What is the deductible?

references.filepath: MOH/MediShield Life/Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured (Nov 2024).pdf
references.citation: Ministry of Health, "Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured." (2024): 1-27.
references.quote: What is co -insurance?

references.filepath: MOH/MediShield Life/Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured (Nov 2024).pdf
references.citation: Ministry of Health, "Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured." (2024): 1-27.
references.quote: The deductible is the fixed amount that you need to pay before MediShield Life payout starts.

references.filepath: MOH/MediShield Life/Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured (Nov 2024).pdf
references.citation: Ministry of Health, "Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured." (2024): 1-27.
references.quote: Co-insurance is the percentage of the claimable amount that you need to pay.

references.filepath: MOH/MediShield Life/Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured (Nov 2024).pdf
references.citation: Ministry of Health, "Information Booklet For The NewlyInsured." (2024): 1-27.
references.quote: What is an Integrated Shield Plan?

references.filepath: MOH/ISPs/About Integrated Shield Plan (Jan 2025).pdf
references.citation: Ministry of Health, "About Integrated Shield Plan." (2025): 1-5.
references.quote: Integrated Shield Plan IP is a private medical insurance plan, offered by private insurers, that provides you with additional coverage on top of what you already have under MediShield Life.

suggestedResponses: How does MediShield Life differ from Integrated Shield Plans?
What are the premiums for MediShield Life?
